alert.note: Alert for Bourbon (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 11:05AM EST until February 18 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky... Stoner Creek at Paris affecting Bourbon County. .Heavy rain from the past 48 hours has caused the river to rise. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stoner Creek at Paris. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water floods a few low roads on right bank of creek. At 20.0 feet, Water enters yards of homes downstream of water plant. Parts of the Garrard Park flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM EST Friday the stage was 19.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 AM EST Friday was 19.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 15.6 feet early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.6 feet on 06/24/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are affected by these crests take any necessary actions. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index. php?wfo=lmk Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued later tonight.
